articles.title: Can flickering lights and sound slow Alzheimer’s? A researcher seeks that answer - CNN
articles.description: A Georgia Tech researcher is turning flickering light and sound into a new tool in the fight against Alzheimer’s, using rhythmic sensory stimulation to “tune” brain waves, boost memory, and potentially slow the disease’s progression. Her hope is that this non…
articles.content:
Can Alzheimers disease be slowed by flickering lights and sound?

articles.content:
